column1: 138kph, swinging away, he drives and gets a thick edge that flies safely through the vacant gully and carries beyond the circle to third man
138kph, yorker, right on the money, he just digs it out. Brilliant delivery and equally well played
137kph, length ball across him, he flashes and misses trying to square drive
138kph, fuller outside off, he mistimes a drive slowly to mid off and runs with the stroke
137kph, angled down leg, does he get a tickle or does it come off pad? Either way it fell short of Carey
137kph, angled into the hip, he jumps back and glances this to wide fine leg and they push for two but only get one
138kph, full and some swing into the left hander, he pushes a drive to mid on and takes a tight single
138kph, fuller outside off, he reaches away from his body and miscues a drive to mid off
134kph, good length outside off, he tries to drive but drags it off the thick inside half off the bat through square leg to the sweeper
he shuffles down to a 140kph full inswinger, beaten for pace, it comes off the pad and rolls away. He was hit outside leg
beaten by a 138kph, good length wobbling in and seaming away outside off
he charges and lofts this over mid on! Didn't nail it. It was 138kph, shaping in a length and he shimmied down to turn it to a half volley. Good shot
140kph, fired down the leg side and called wide
swinging way down the leg side and rightly called wide again. Carey has to dive a long way
thumping square drive straight through Turner at point. It was a length ball and wide, he stands tall and crunches past Turner at point

Given out LBW. He's been given and Babar reviews. This was full and shaping into the pad late. There was a big appeal and it carried to slip. There's no bat involved. Nothing on hot spot. RTS appears to say pad only. Daylight between bat and ball. Ball tracking is a little slow. We have to wait 30 seconds for ball tracking. Ball tracking says umpire's call! Clipping leg. It stays out LBW. It was just pitching in line and just clipping the outside of leg.

Bowled him! Searing 140kph inswinger! This was like a heat-seeking missile. Started on off, swung late through a gaping gate as he tried to drive away from his body. His pads were outside leg, his bat outside off, the ball swerved through and crashed into middle and leg
142kph, good length outswinger on off, he pushes a drive to mid off
142kph, fuller length, no swing, he drives firmly back to the bowler and it comes off Starc and ricochets to mid off
138kph, bouncer and he ducks under it easily
good length, hint of shape across him, he pushes a length ball to point
he charges early and it's banged in 131kph, into the ribs and he defends knocking it down
short on leg, he pulls to wide fine leg, they push hard for two on Abbott's arm and Imam has to dive to make it! They check upstairs but he's home just
137kph, short ball, over middle, he backs away and tries to uppercut but misses
137kph, short ball, he pulls and miscues off the top edge but it lands safely at the circle at midwicket
play and miss at a135kph length ball that swung away late
132kph, length ball, top of off, he defends from the crease towards point
thumped straight over the umpire's head! 132kph, in the slot and he swings through the line and hammers it straight at the sightscreen

top edge caught at midwicket! Short ball banged in outside off, he tries to pull but goes from low to high with his hands, gets a top edge that flies straight up to midwicket, McDermott camps under it and takes the catch very easily. That was a poorly executed stroke
135kph, good length fourth stump line, he pushes towards mid off
132kph, back of a length, he pushes away from his body to backward point and Smith makes a superb diving save
133kph, back of a length outside off, he's back and across and defending
back of a length on off, he stands up and defends
144kph, full inswinger and he whips with the swing behind square Good shot. Conventional stroke, using the pace to ping it behind square
over-pitched wide of off, he opens the shoulder and hammers a cover drive. That was a half volley and he put it away easily
141kph, fuller outside off, he tries to drive he miscues to mid on
138kph, bouncer over leg, he half pulls half ducks, it flies through to Carey. No wide call
magnificent cover drive! Another long half volley and he leans forward to pound it through the big gap at cover.
short ball into the ribs, he gets inside the line and works it around the corner to fine leg
134kph, short ball, climbing outside off, he tries to cut and it beats him for bounce
142kph, fuller outside off, he drives hard and slices a thick outside edge high and wide of third man
thick edge nearly carries to third man! Richardson ran in off the rope and couldn't block the half volley. It was a good effort to try and catch it. That edge flew a long way
138kph, back of a length on off, he defends to cover-point
141kph, fuller on off, he drives back to the bowler, Stanlake deflects it onto the stumps at the non-strikers but Haris is back safely
fuller outside off, he drives firmly through cover straight of the man in the deep for a couple
91kph, shorter length, he's back and punching down to long off
arm ball drifting into leg, he's back and punching wide of long on, they push for two and beat the throw from Richardson. Good running
slower and shorter, with some spin, he's back and punching this to long on
102kph, low full toss, whipped to deep midwicket
shorter length, slid through at 98kph, he's back and cutting to backward point
147kph, over-pitched, he drives very nicely straight of mid off, Warner moves like a hare across the turf to dive and make the save
142kph, angled into leg, he glances this to fine leg with ease
142kph, bouncer, over leg stump, he ducks under it easily
140kph, bouncer, down the leg side and called wide
141kph, shorter length into the hip, he tucks this behind square for a single
135kph, over-pitched, he crunches a straight drive back and it comes off his boot and flies to mid on
138kph, shorter length, into the ribs, he tucks this to fine leg

caught at long off! That was brilliant from Agar. Haris jumped down early, Agar dragged the length down, Haris went through with the shot, mistimed it trying to launch over long off, he clothed it straight down Richardson's throat at long off. Easy catch 15 metres in off the rope
tossed up slower, he works with the turn towards long on, he pushes for two but it's not on
drifting into middle, he's back and working this through midwicket
drifting outside off, he drives, without timing past cover to the sweeper in the deep
tossed up, he pushes gently to cover point for one
shorter length, he's back and cutting to backward point
short of a length, thuds into Khushdil's chest, the pair scamper through for one
pulled belligerently but no timing, straight to mid-on
cut away to third man. Stanlake is persisting with that short length, and doing a good job with it
fuller length, steered to midwicket
driven to mid-off, pair scuttle through for another quick single. This is good stuff from Australia
excellent over. Pakistan really going nowhere at the moment, and the pressure Iftikhar feels is understandable. His wicket could be the game
chipper to long-off
straight back to the bowler
the reverse sweep comes out. No timing, but that allows Pakistan to come back for two
guided past short cover-point for one
runs it to backward point for a single
poked to fine leg, and another tidy over concludes

this won't help improve their mood! Khushdil cleared his front leg and looked to tonk this into the stands behind midwicket. It went so high the keeper thought he might catch it, but in the end Starc at fine leg got himself into position and snared a swirling one. Pakistan lose half their side.
short and wide, and finally a boundary comes! The width allowed Iftikhar to slash at it, and it races to the third man boundary
better delivery, defended
short ball again, muscled to midwicket. Gets clean contact on that and they come back for two
cut straight to backward point

no control from the batsman, but it's four! Top edge that nearly carried all the way for six; when you're in form like Iftikhar is, everything goes your way. Turned out to be a decent over from Pakistan despite the wicket; they need to get a move on
cut away for one
poor delivery, gets away with it. Down legside, and Iftikhar gives it a slap, but fine leg is there to cut it off
no timing from Imad, but they come back for two
a whack down the ground, but again, got very little of the middle of the bat on it
guided to square leg, Agar has been so tight today. Fantastic spin bowling.
excellent over once more. Just what Australia needed after a slightly expensive one from Richardson
Imad goes down the ground, the length is dragged back, and he can only splice it to the onside for one
good timing, but Abbott is bowling short of a length at pace, and Iftikhar doesn't have enough time to get underneath it

gone! What a catch! Agar can't put a foot wrong today. Not a surprise, in truth. Nothing had been working for Imad in the short time he';d been there. I don't believe he middled a single ball. Similar shot to the previous one. Came down the pitch, and the length was too short for him to get any purchase on the shot. Agar sprinted forward to scoop it up inches from the ground
Shadab nearly got himself run out. No communication between the two, and Shadab at the non-striker's end would have been gone with a direct hit
steered to third man
blocks and sets off rather aimlessly, Iftikhar knows better than to take him up on the offer.
Scooped into the vacant legside infield from Iftikhar. think he was looking to get it into a deserted enough area to come back for two
Pace and bounce. Lovely stuff from Stanlake. Tentative poke and a miss
Nudged to short backward point and Shadab gets himself off strike

excellent bowling again. Short and Iftikhar didn't quite know what to do with it. Lucky he didn't edge it straight back to the bowler. Almost comes back and hits his stumps, the batsman had to stop it with his bat
pulled to fine leg
makes room for himself and Stanlake throws it well outside off stump. Never quite in position to execute the extravagant cut, and it's another swing and a miss

massive blow for Pakistan! Heaved down to fine leg from Iftikhar. He'd been struggling with the short ball for much of the innings, and Starc at fine leg was secure as ever. Richardson, who copped such heavy punishment from Iftikhar last game, get's his revenge
clattered straight to point
swing and a miss. Shadab one off six now. Needs to kick on badly
copy and paste. This time he tried a swivel-pull, but Carey gathers it behind the stumps again

the miserable innings comes to an end! Well, colour me surprised! Shadab had been struggling badly all eight balls he was there, and this time, he got a thick edge. Mid-on made a bit of a meal of it, but that's it for the allrounder

wow, what was that from Hasnain! No double wicket maiden for Richardson, as Hasnain middles his first ball for an exquisite cover drive that goes straight to the boundary! Watch and learn, Imad and Shadab, the teenager might meekly mutter to himself
dragged down legside
backs away, does Amir, and tentatively times it back down the ground
that's better! First maximum of the night. Amir backs away again, but it was the shorter delivery that allowed Amir to get a thick edge on it, which carried all the way over the third man boundary
straight to the fielder
yorker, Amir digs it out and the pair change ends
he was barely in the same postcode. Looked to repeat the shot he played so well off Richardson, but the shorter length renders it impossible
yorker that just misses leg stump
run down to third man
wild swing from Hasnain, but Richardson says 'I deserve more respect' with a ball that flummoxes the number 10 completely
Carbon copy. Hasnain might have to consider descending from cloud nine, where he might still be after that lovely cover drive first ball. Needs to rotate the strike
but who cares what I think? Another lavish swing, another obvious miss. One off four balls this over
four in a row. Nothing connecting for Hasnain now, and Amir can only watch from the other end
swing and a miss. Hasnain has clearly decided that is all he wants to do. top stuff from Richardson. Just one off that over
short ball, Amir ducks below it
Amir backed away to try and cut it through the covers. Misses again. That's seven balls in a row the bat hasn't made contact with the ball
make that eight! Amir looks to scoop this over fine leg. Doesn't even make contact with it
hallelujah, there's bat on ball! And there's even a ticking over of the scores. They take a single. A SINGLE! What will Australia do now?
Hasnain swings like a rusty gate, as they say these days. Just one off five balls this final over

and ends, predictably, with another miss. Two off the final two overs, and on a miserable evening in Perth, Pakistan limp to 106. They trudge off, no sign of a spring in their step, while Australia are practically prancing off the field. This should be comfortable for them
130kph, perfect length, touch of shape away, he's squared up pushing to point
132kph, good length angled in, it comes off the thigh pad

top edge just carries over third man's head! Why was Hasnain off the rope? If he was on the rope he catches that at waist high! It was short and wide but the extra bounce caused the top edge to fly all the way to third man but it's six instead of a wicket
full angled into leg, he pushes to mid on

huge mix up and Imam misses! He did everything right. Warner crunches a cut shot, Imam makes an unbelievable diving save and Warner had taken off thinking he beat him, Imam got up had all the time he needed to throw the stumps down and missed
back of a length, he pushes this to cover-point
back of a length, climbing outside off, and it comes off the stickers as he defends. He was surprised at 137kph
142kph, beats him. Beaten for pace. Feet were anchored, he pushed at it and it zipped past the edge
long half volley and he caresses a square drive through point. Finch had no trouble here. Just placed the gift through the gap
142kph, good length, top of off, he is forced to defend back to the bowler
139kph, back of a length, middle and off, he punches off the back foot but drags it to mid on
short and fractionally wide, Finch cuts with authority, placing it through point. He got on top of the bounce and it raced through the infield
dismissive pull shot. Fractionally short, he rocked back and with a short arm jab smacks it wide of mid on
123kph, slower outswinger, he's squared up but guiding it away to third man
134kph, swinging down the leg side. A long way down, Rizwan dives to take it
135kph, good length, shaping back into the thigh pad, he can't whip it away
135kph, good length, but swinging down the leg side again
back of a length outside off, he's back and punching this to wide mid off and running sharply for an easy one
135kph, short and very wide, he tries to upper cut with amazing bat speed but is beaten for bounce
125kph, slower outswinger, he's back and jabbing a cut to point
147kph, very full on off, Finch is hanging back, left leg out of the way, he mistimes a drive to mid off
143kph, full on off, he swings hard trying to hit down the ground, gets a thick inside edge that runs behind square
145kph, very full outside off, he squeezes a push into cover for a single
hooked for six off the top edge. 143kph, bouncer right at the helmet, but fine leg is up, Finch swivelled and was hurried but the top edge goes all the way
short and wide and cracked forward of point! It was in the air at a catchable height but wide of the man. Just a bad ball and met with a flashing blade
140kph, chest high short ball, he ropes a pull at speed flat but short of the deep square on the fence
141kph, good length, angled into the thigh pad, it comes off the thigh and runs to short fine
146kph, outswinger outside off, back of a length, he's beaten fending away from his body
144kph, angled into leg stump, full, he clips this neatly through square midwicket, the man in the deep is backward of square, they take on the throw for two and beat him
pulled over square leg! Cracking shot. Finch at his best. Shoulder high short ball outside off, he was back set up to hammer it, got it out of the screws and cleared the man on the rope easily!
142kph, good length on middle, he pushes this neatly straight of mid on
145kph, shorter length on middle, he leans back and lets it run off the angled bat to third man
126kph, angled into leg, he works this off his pads square of midwicket for a single
good length on off, he pushes to mid off, he calls yes but then sends Warner back quickly
136kph, back of a length outside off, he's back and mistiming a back foot drive wide of mid off
138kph, low full toss, he just punches it for four straight down the ground. That was a little too easy
135kph, predictable bouncer and it's too high
139kph, short ball, he rolls with a pull shot and the placement and timing is superb. He beats the two men on the rope. Picked the gap perfectly
126kph, good length on middle, he works to midwicket but can't find a single
short and wide, he smokes a cut shot and it hits Shadab's wrist on the half volley. That stung. it bounces away for one
143kph, bouncer, he sways inside the line
145kph, angled down the leg side and called wide
141kph, shorter length, he mistimes a pull shot wide of mid on for a couple
length ball angled into the hip, he tucks it behind square just outside the circle and sprints for two. Exceptional running from Warner
133kph, slung into leg stump, it cramps him and takes him on the thigh, Finch calls him through though
141kph, fuller on off, he's back and hanging outside leg, he punches straight to cover
89kph short and wide, he's back and slapping a cut shot in the air towards the deep cover-point
fuller outside off, he skips down and crushes a drive straight to long off. That was lasered
92kph, shorter, he's back and pulling to wide long on, they run brilliantly to pinch two

in the slot, he stands and launches it over long on into the stands! It was caught in the crowd! This was just lobbed up in the arc, Warner spotted it, stood still and teed off. He got it out of the screws
shorter on middle, he's back and tucking this to midwicket, again he calls two immediately and gets there easily
shorter length, he's back and punching to cover
full toss slips out! It is sprayed way down leg and Rizwan produces some great acrobatics to knock it down
length ball on middle, he swings hard but drags it off the inside edge through square leg. That was a proper mow
launched over square leg again! This has gone nearly 100m! Chest high short ball outside off, he's camped back and ready to swing hard. Again he flushed it
good length, he clears the left leg, and smears it across the line, but he mistimes this to midwicket
141kph, good length, he's back and jabbing a cut to backward point
141kph, good length top of off, he's back and pushing it to the gap at cover-point
good length, he's jammed up, punching it off the gloves to point
good length, top of middle, he pushes this to mid on for one
143kph, fuller outside off, he drives open chested to mid off
123kph, slower ball on leg, he chips this over midwicket without timing for a couple
143kph, length ball outside off, he just mows this across the line along the ground and it runs all the way! He didn't time it but still got enough of it
good length wide of off, he's back and running this to third man
142kph, short outside off, he's back and punching to deep point
driven through the offside
slower ball, swing and a miss from Warner. That was more like what Hasnain was doing at the tailend of the last innings. Suspect it won't happen nine times in a row though
short again. Warner watches it go by while fixing the umpire with a piercing look, who obliges and calls it awide
didn't middle this, flew through to deep cover, where Iftikhar was racing in. Falls slightly short though, meaning the possibility of a 10-wicket win is still very much on
stroked to mid-off
slower ball once more. Tidy over so far, this, but Australia just eight runs away
attempted pull by Finch, and the inside edge clips it onto his pads. He keeps the strike. Into the 12th over we go now
Finch thought about walloping this, but realised just in time he was getting a free run. 5 away from his half-century
misfield allows the Australian openers to come back for two. Four away from as eries win, each batsman three away from 50
brilliant stop at backward point from Shadab. He's an excellent fielder in that position, one of the best in the world, in truth
low full toss, Finch drives through the air to long-on on the bounce. Right, three to win. Will Warner get his half-century instead, then?
not yet, nurdles it down to fine leg

and that brings it to an end! 50 for Finch, a series win for Australia. This is a blinding performance from the hosts against the world's number one team. They've made them look astonishingly pedestrian, and should do their confidence the world of good before the Test series. There's no sugar-coating this; Pakistan have been humbled here.
